duties_responsibilities.duty: Install, test, and maintain high-speed fiber optic transmission equipment, circuits, and small cell networks
Respond to network outages, impairments, and emergencies in assigned area
Conduct preventative maintenance inspections to company standards
Operate fiber optic and RF related test equipment
Perform advanced analysis and troubleshooting of issues and assist customers
Conduct site surveys and quality review of remote locations
Perform hardware and software updates and changes to remote site equipment
Operate PC or similar devices to access network nodes and perform assigned administrative tasks
Work with cross-functional departments and peers to ensure efficient operations
Comply with all company policies and procedures
Participate in on-call rotation schedule for nights and weekend coverage
Follow safe work practices and maintain integrity and quality

education_certification.credential: High School Degree or equivalent required
Associates or two-year Technical degree strongly preferred
Wireless/Wireline Operations, Ethernet certification or equivalent military experience preferred
Valid state driver’s license with a non-negligent driving record
